DataElement.preferredName: Residual Disease Physical Examination Diagnostic Imaging Detected Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Cancer cells that remain after attempts to remove the cancer have been made._A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment._Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.._Detected; perceived or discerned._an assessment response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Residual Disease Physical Examination Diagnostic Imaging Detected
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cancer cells that remain after attempts to remove the cancer have been made._A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment._Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.._Detected; perceived or discerned.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer cells that remain after attempts to remove the cancer have been made.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: Tumor cells that remain in the body following cancer treatment.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..:Detected; perceived or discerned.

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If so, is there residual dise
ReferenceDocuments.description: If so, is there residual disease that is evaluable clinically and/or by CT or MRI imaging?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is definite residual disease visible on the MRI?
